titleStmt.title: Digital Edition of Glaser Abklatsch ID: AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-B173g
AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-B173g

item.term: Early first millennium to the fourth century BC (predominance of Saba)
Fourth to first centuries BC (predominance of Qataban and Hadramawt, and their alliance with Main)
First century BC to early second century AD (alliances between the tribes of the high plateau and the ASA kingdoms)
Late second to late third centuries AD (wars among the Himyar, Saba and Hadramawt)
Fourth to sixth centuries AD (unification of Yemen under Himyarite rule)
It corresponds to the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans with sub-periods I-IV
First sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Third sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans

1.[ydʿ]ʾb | ḏb[yn |] 2.[bn | šhr | m]krb | qt[bn | w-kl | w=] 3.[ld | ʿm | w-]ʾwsn | (w-)[kḥd | w-d=] 4.[hsm | w-tbn]w | w-yr[fʾ | ʾymnn] 5.[w-ʾšʾmn | nq]z | w-wzl | [w-brr | msbʾ] 6.[w-mnql | ẓrm |] (b-)ʾmr | ʿm | [ḏ-šqr | b-ʿm | w-b] 7.[ʾnby | w-b | ʿm | ḏ-]rymtm | w-[b | ʿm-ḏ-šqr | w-b] 8.[ḥwkm | w-b | ḏt | ṣ]ntm | w-b | [ḏt | ẓhrn | w-b | ḏt | rḥbn] 9.[ʾwsʿm | bn | yṣr]ʿm | bn | md[hm | tqdm | w-ḥrg | kl] 10.[ʿšq | w-wzl | w-ṣl]l | mnqln | [ẓrm | b-tḥrg | mrʾ-s] 11.[ydʿʾb]

Text preserved in this squeeze:
1.[Yadaʿ]ʾab Dhub[yān] 2.[r]uler of Qata[bān] 3.ʾAwsān and 4.[...] and Yar[faʾ] 5.[...] and carved out 6.at the command of ʿAmm 7.Raymatim, and by 8.[by Dhāt-Ṣa]natim, and by Dhāt- 9.[...]ʿamm, of the lineage of Madi[...] 10.[...] the mountain pass
Restored full text of the inscription:
1.[Yadaʿ]ʾab Dhub[yān] 2.[bin Shahr, the r]uler of Qata[bān and all of the child-] 3.[ren of ʿAmm and] ʾAwsān and [Kaḥid and Da-] 4.[hasum and Tuban]ū and Yar[faʾ, the southern reaches] 5.[and the northern reaches, has cu]t and carved out [and levelled the road] 6.[and the mountain pass of Ẓarrum] at the command of ʿAmm [Dhū-Shaqīr. By ʿAmm, and by] 7.[ʾAnbay, and by ʿAmm Dhū-]Raymatim, and by [ʿAmm Dhū-Shaqīr, and by] 8.[Ḥawkam, and by Dhāt-Ṣa]natim, and by Dhāt-[Ẓahrān, and by Dhāt-Raḥbān.] 9.[ʾAwsʿamm, the son of Yiṣur]ʿamm, of the lineage of Madi[hum, led and commanded all of] 10.[the cutting and carving out and smooth]ing of the mountain pass of [Ẓarrum, by the command of his lord,] 11.[Yadaʿʾab.]

Text preserved in this squeeze:
Yadaʿʾab Dhubyān
ruler of Qatabān
ʾAwsān and
... and Yarfaʾ
... and carved out
at the command of ʿAmm
Raymatim, and by
by Dhāt-Ṣanatim, and by Dhāt-
...ʿamm, of the lineage of Madi...
... the mountain pass
Restored full text of the inscription:
Yadaʿʾab Dhubyān
bin Shahr, the ruler of Qatabān and all of the child-
ren of ʿAmm and ʾAwsān and Kaḥid and Da-
hasum and Tubanū and Yarfaʾ, the southern reaches
and the northern reaches, has cut and carved out and levelled the road
and the mountain pass of Ẓarrum at the command of ʿAmm Dhū-Shaqīr. By ʿAmm, and by
ʾAnbay, and by ʿAmm Dhū-Raymatim, and by ʿAmm Dhū-Shaqīr, and by
Ḥawkam, and by Dhāt-Ṣanatim, and by Dhāt-Ẓahrān, and by Dhāt-Raḥbān.
ʾAwsʿamm, the son of Yiṣurʿamm, of the lineage of Madihum, led and commanded all of
the cutting and carving out and smoothing of the mountain pass of Ẓarrum, by the command of his lord,
Yadaʿʾab.

Text preserved in this squeeze:

Restored full text of the inscription:
Yadaʿʾab Dhubyān
bin Shahr, the ruler of Qatabān and all of the child-
ren of ʿAmm and ʾAwsān and Kaḥid and Da-
hasum and Tubanū and Yarfaʾ, the southern reaches
and the northern reaches, has cut and carved out and levelled the road
and the mountain pass of Ẓarrum at the command of ʿAmm Dhū-Shaqīr. By ʿAmm, and by
ʾAnbay, and by ʿAmm Dhū-Raymatim, and by ʿAmm Dhū-Shaqīr, and by
Ḥawkam, and by Dhāt-Ṣanatim, and by Dhāt-Ẓahrān, and by Dhāt-Raḥbān.
ʾAwsʿamm, the son of Yiṣurʿamm, of the lineage of Madihum, led and commanded all of
the cutting and carving out and smoothing of the mountain pass of Ẓarrum, by the command of his lord,
Yadaʿʾab.

Restored full text of the inscription:
Yadaʿʾab Dhubyān
bin Shahr, the ruler of Qatabān and all of the child-
ren of ʿAmm and ʾAwsān and Kaḥid and Da-
hasum and Tubanū and Yarfaʾ, the southern reaches
and the northern reaches, has cut and carved out and levelled the road
and the mountain pass of Ẓarrum at the command of ʿAmm Dhū-Shaqīr. By ʿAmm, and by
ʾAnbay, and by ʿAmm Dhū-Raymatim, and by ʿAmm Dhū-Shaqīr, and by
Ḥawkam, and by Dhāt-Ṣanatim, and by Dhāt-Ẓahrān, and by Dhāt-Raḥbān.
ʾAwsʿamm, the son of Yiṣurʿamm, of the lineage of Madihum, led and commanded all of
the cutting and carving out and smoothing of the mountain pass of Ẓarrum, by the command of his lord,
Yadaʿʾab.
